AD_Onlooker01.synopsis: A small AD for one of the execution on-lookers for when situation haven't been interacted with yet.Will be playing alternately with other onlookers.
AD_Onlooker01.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.The dialog will be triggered from time to time before players engage in the situation.

AD_CryHelpEachTurn.synopsis: Short AD lines for Volo in cart when it started moving toward the trapped finish point.
AD_CryHelpEachTurn.how_to_trigger: - Start Volo's Fate situation;- Proceed through the execution scene;- Agitator should set Volo's cart in motion; - Volo will begin ADing each turn;

Thug02.synopsis: A small one-liner for one of the thugs who captured Volo and prepare to execute him.Can be triggered from stealth or when the execution scene is still on-going. After it is done - the character won't be available for dialog.
Thug02.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.One player character should start the execution scene, another player character can talk to other NPCs.

Saved.synopsis: Volo was saved from being exploded and is grateful to players for saving him.
Saved.how_to_trigger: Save Volo at the place of execution in the docs, in fron of the Steelwatch Foundry at approximately: -229; 4; -160

Execution.synopsis: Volo is being publically executed in the docs by some agitators in front of an angry mob. Volo is tied to a chair on a cart full of explosives, the trail of alcohol leads to it from the angry mob. The agitator has the torch in his hands and drops it on the trail of alcohol in the end of the dialog.
Execution.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of execution in the Docks, in front of the Steelwatch Foundry at approximately: -229; 4; -160

AD_Onlooker03.synopsis: A small AD for one of the execution on-lookers for when situation haven't been interacted with yet.Will be playing alternately with other onlookers.
AD_Onlooker03.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.The dialog will be triggered from time to time before players engage in the situation.

Onlooker02.synopsis: A small one-liner for one of the thugs who captured Volo and prepare to execute him.Can be triggered from stealth or when the execution scene is still on-going. After it is done - the character won't be available for dialog.
Onlooker02.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.One player character should start the execution scene, another player character can talk to other NPCs.

AD_Agitator.synopsis: A idle AD for agitator who is about to execute Volo.Volo can whimper replies.
AD_Agitator.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.The dialog will be triggered from time to time before players engage in the situation.

Onlooker03.synopsis: A small one-liner for one of the thugs who captured Volo and prepare to execute him.Can be triggered from stealth or when the execution scene is still on-going. After it is done - the character won't be available for dialog.
Onlooker03.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.One player character should start the execution scene, another player character can talk to other NPCs.

Onlooker01.synopsis: A small one-liner for one of the thugs who captured Volo and prepare to execute him.Can be triggered from stealth or when the execution scene is still on-going. After it is done - the character won't be available for dialog.
Onlooker01.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.One player character should start the execution scene, another player character can talk to other NPCs.

Thug01.synopsis: A small one-liner for one of the thugs who captured Volo and prepare to execute him.Can be triggered from stealth or when the execution scene is still on-going. After it is done - the character won't be available for dialog.
Thug01.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.One player character should start the execution scene, another player character can talk to other NPCs.

AD_BusyInCart.synopsis: Triggered when players interacti with Volo, while he is tied to the cart, awaiting release by player.
AD_BusyInCart.how_to_trigger: - Trigger Volo's Fate situation; - Finish execution scene; - Make sure Volo doesn't explode (by destroying the barrels at the endpoint); - Click on Volo;

AD_Saved.synopsis: Volo was saved from the execution, but haven't triggered his Saved interactive dialog.
AD_Saved.how_to_trigger: Save Volo at the place of execution in the docs, in front of the Steelwatch Foundry at approximately: -229; 4; -160

Onlooker04.synopsis: A small one-liner for one of the thugs who captured Volo and prepare to execute him.Can be triggered from stealth or when the execution scene is still on-going. After it is done - the character won't be available for dialog.
Onlooker04.how_to_trigger: Approach the place of the situation at -229; 4; -160 in lower city, in the docks, near the steelwatch foundry.One player character should start the execution scene, another player character can talk to other NPCs.

AD_Onlooker01_1.speaker: Saff Fargoer
AD_Onlooker01_1.text: Burn him! Burn him! Burn him!

AD_CryHelpEachTurn_2.speaker: Volo
AD_CryHelpEachTurn_2.text: This would be fascinating if it were happening to somebody else!

Thug02_1.speaker: Antinia the Goon
Thug02_1.text: Did I not make myself clear? I'm not babysitting any more chatterboxes.

Saved_1.speaker: Volo
Saved_1.text: That explosion - that was you, wasn't it? Don't worry, I won't pry, but whatever it was you did - it saved my life.

Saved_8.speaker: Volo
Saved_8.text: Those uninformed clods were about to blow me to pieces for simply trying to keep the public informed! Whatever happened to respecting the truth, hm? Anyway.

Saved_9.speaker: Volo
Saved_9.text: I suppose thanks are in order, again.

Saved_7.speaker: Volo
Saved_7.text: Though you could have tried to stop them before they set me on fire.

Saved_0.speaker: Volo
Saved_0.text: But no harm, no foul, I suppose. What's an heroic story without a little risking of one's neck, eh?
Saved_0.context: NodeContext: nervous, not really feeling as light-hearted as the words he's saying

Saved_6.speaker: Volo
Saved_6.text: And you know what they say - the bigger the story, the more people want to kill you for it.

Saved_3.speaker: Volo
Saved_3.text: You of all people will... ah... know what I mean.

Saved_4.speaker: Volo
Saved_4.text: I'll, er... tell you what I know. But not here. Too many eyes, ears, and weapons about. Meet me at your camp.

Saved_2.speaker: Volo
Saved_2.text: I'll tell you all about it. But not here. Too many eyes, ears, and weapons about. Meet me at your camp.

Saved_5.speaker: Volo
Saved_5.text: What's an heroic story without a little risking of one's neck, eh?

Saved_10.speaker: Volo
Saved_10.text: I suppose thanks are in order.

Saved_11.speaker: Volo
Saved_11.text: Gods... I really thought I was done for.

Execution_15.speaker: Volo
Execution_15.text: It's not a lie! If you would just listen - I can explain!
Execution_15.context:
CinematicNodeContext: An angry mob is gathered around a dockyard cart on which Volo is tied up, struggling. 
SFX of angry crowd clamouring in background. No specific words needed.

Execution_22.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_22.text: You have done quite enough 'explaining', Volothamp Geddarm.
Execution_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: The crowd goes quiet to listen to the 'sermon'-like speech of the agitator.

Execution_0.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_0.text: You have poisoned the very hearts and minds of these good, kind, gentle citizens, with your lies. Your delusions. Your conspiracies.

Execution_14.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_14.text: Though you hide behind a mask of stories, we have seen beyond the veil. We see what you really are - fearmonger.

Execution_29.speaker: Saff Fargoer
Execution_29.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX Accompanied by background cheering of the same line from the crowd.

Execution_49.speaker: Saff Fargoer
Execution_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX Accompanied by background cheering of the same line from the crowd.

Execution_44.speaker: Narrator
Execution_44.text: *Your parasite stirs in recognition. This man is infected.*

Execution_45.speaker: Saff Fargoer
Execution_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX Accompanied by background cheering - this is the only line discernible.

Execution_7.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_7.text: Today, citizens, we rid ourselves of this cankerous sore. Today, we burn away all falsehoods. Today, we will be divided no longer, for today we rise in TRUTH!
Execution_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: SFX Crowd cheers in agreement and bloodlust when he's done. NodeContext: His fervor rising with every phrase.

Execution_47.speaker: Minsc
Execution_47.text: This man is no enemy of the people! This man could not even hurt a mouse! I know - I have seen him try!

Execution_13.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_13.text: What's this? Another heretic in our midst?

Execution_54.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_54.text: Another mind, clouded by the disruptor's lies. Another soul to cleanse.

Execution_10.speaker: Volo
Execution_10.text: Psst - don't just stand there. Help me goddsdammit. HELP ME.
Execution_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Volo addresses the player from where he's boundNodeContext: hissed desperate whisper

Execution_23.speaker: Karlach
Execution_23.text: We're not going to let this happen, are we? Volo's... well, he's Volo.
Execution_23.context: NodeContext: Doesn't have a strong reason to save him but she still wants to.

Execution_3.speaker: Jaheira
Execution_3.text: Of course we'll save you, Volo. I think this mob has made the rather silly mistake of taking you seriously.
Execution_3.context: NodeContext: Amused to see her old fraudulent friend on trial in front of a mob - but mostly because she's confident we'll step in to stop it

Execution_18.speaker: Player
Execution_18.text: Volo has done no harm - you, on the other hand, serve the Absolute.

Execution_35.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_35.text: What's this? The opportune wielding of a weapon?

Execution_32.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_32.text: It seems, dear citizens, that we have a HERETIC in our midst.
Execution_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: He addresses the crowd.NodeContext: as if sharing with the crowd a great joke

Execution_16.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_16.text: Well we are nothing if not gracious. Let us see if we cannot lift the veil from their eyes too!

Execution_21.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The agitator raises a torch over the trail of alcohol leading to Volo's cart full of explosives.

We can show just the raising of the torch, leaving the trail and vart off shot

Execution_46.speaker: Volo
Execution_46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Agitator raises torch about to drop it onto flammable surface. (The actual drop happens in gameplay.)NodeContext: Volo is about to be set on fire

Execution_39.speaker: Player
Execution_39.text: What crime is this man guilty of? If he is guilty, where's the evidence? Where's the trial? This isn't justice - this is mob madness!

Execution_50.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_50.text: The newcomer speaks! And speaks of evidence, and trials, and justice.
Execution_50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Agitator addresses the crowd, referencing the player.

Execution_20.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_20.text: And in so doing, they delay their very own salvation.

Execution_52.speaker: Churg Elvek
Execution_52.text: Dear citizen, dear friend, rest assured you will have your justice, but I'm afraid the time for trials has passed. Now is the time for judgement.
Execution_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: He addresses the player directly. NodeContext: Sickly sweet at first, fire and brimstone on the last line

Execution_4.speaker: Player
Execution_4.text: Well go on then, do whatever it is you're planning to do to him.

Execution_6.speaker: Volo
Execution_6.text: No - No - please - no... I take it back!

Execution_37.speaker: Player
Execution_37.text: You would kill a man for spinning yarns? For telling stories? Please, this is ridiculous.

Execution_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Execution_5.text: This promises to be an amusing spectacle. Let us see if death can silence Volo at last.
Execution_5.context: NodeContext: amused, preparing to watch Volo die by mob justice. He's worthless to her, so she genuinely finds it an amusing spectacle

Execution_25.speaker: Lae'zel
Execution_25.text: A madman Volo may be, but I see no reason to blow him up over it.

Execution_33.speaker: Wyll
Execution_33.text: By the gods, do something. Or are you going to let them blow up the poor guy?

Execution_41.speaker: Shadowheart
Execution_41.text: I suppose we should aid him... though I'd hate to miss the show.

Execution_48.speaker: Gale
Execution_48.text: I really think we ought to step in here. Whatever his crime, this punishment is surely an overcorrection.

Execution_51.speaker: Astarion
Execution_51.text: This damsel may be middle-aged, but let's get him out of distress.

Execution_53.speaker: Halsin
Execution_53.text: Perhaps we should aid him - he is an old friend, after all. Or at least... an old acquaintance.

Execution_55.speaker: Karlach
Execution_55.text: Poor guy looks like he could really use a hand. I've got two, hey?
Execution_55.context: NodeContext: 'Let's help him, I volunteer as tribute.'

Execution_11.speaker: Jaheira
Execution_11.text: Come, let us free the bard from his adoring fans. And their rather accurate charges.
Execution_11.context: NodeContext: Amused to see her old fraudulent friend on trial in front of a mob - but mostly because she's confident we'll step in to stop it

Execution_31.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Execution_31.text: This promises to be an amusing spectacle, and the accused is guilty of offending my ears at the very least.
Execution_31.context: NodeContext: amused, preparing to watch Volo die by mob justice. He's worthless to her, so she genuinely finds it an amusing spectacle

Execution_30.speaker: Lae'zel
Execution_30.text: I won't keep you from helping. But an explosion sounds far more entertaining.

Execution_27.speaker: Wyll
Execution_27.text: Volothamp Geddarm? By the gods, do something!

Execution_42.speaker: Shadowheart
Execution_42.text: I suppose we should aid him... though I'd hate to miss the show.

Execution_17.speaker: Gale
Execution_17.text: I really think we ought to step in here. Whatever his crime, this punishment is surely an overcorrection.

Execution_8.speaker: Astarion
Execution_8.text: This damsel may be middle-aged, but let's get him out of distress.

Execution_1.speaker: Halsin
Execution_1.text: Perhaps we should aid him - though we risk angering the crowd if we do.

AD_Onlooker03_1.speaker: Slorsha Grommer
AD_Onlooker03_1.text: Hang him! Hang him 'til he's dead!

Onlooker02_0.speaker: Falmor Duguir
Onlooker02_0.text: Did you listen to him too? I thought I knew better, but he was just so convincing...

Onlooker02_1.speaker: Falmor Duguir
Onlooker02_1.text: He got inside my head. Twisted my thoughts. Evil, I tell you. Pure evil.

AD_Agitator_3.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_3.text: Will we fall victim to falsehoods? NO.

AD_Agitator_0.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_0.text: Will we be prey for a deceiver? NO.

AD_Agitator_12.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_12.text: Will we allow ourselves to be manipulated by misinformation? NO.

AD_Agitator_4.speaker: Volo
AD_Agitator_4.text: There's been a misunderstanding! I'm telling the truth!

AD_Agitator_9.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_9.text: The traitor's tongue wags! Even now, he lies!

AD_Agitator_6.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_6.text: Do not be blinded by smiles and song.

AD_Agitator_5.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_5.text: This man has tried to divide us with his lies. But NO MORE.

AD_Agitator_11.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_11.text: Today, we will have justice. Today, this man will pay!

AD_Agitator_8.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_8.text: Witness, the man behind the corruption.

AD_Agitator_1.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_1.text: Witness the feeble, putrid form of our deceiver.

AD_Agitator_10.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_10.text: Witness - for today, he adopts his greatest role yet...

AD_Agitator_7.speaker: Churg Elvek
AD_Agitator_7.text: Today, Volothamp Geddarm becomes an example of what this city does to liars.

Onlooker03_0.speaker: Slorsha Grommer
Onlooker03_0.text: Thought he was better than us, did he? Where's all that fancy language now?

Onlooker03_1.speaker: Slorsha Grommer
Onlooker03_1.text: Talk, talk, talk - that's all these bards ever do. What use are they? Should've got a real job like the rest of us.

Onlooker01_0.speaker: Saff Fargoer
Onlooker01_0.text: If you join in, perhaps we can get a chant going. Burn him! Burn him! Burn him!

Onlooker01_1.speaker: Saff Fargoer
Onlooker01_1.text: I hope they burn him! I hope he chokes on his final words!

Thug01_0.speaker: Ruffian Ormo
Thug01_0.text: Eyes up there - show won't start any sooner if you pester me about it. My part's done.

Thug01_1.speaker: Ruffian Ormo
Thug01_1.text: Look - just observe like the rest of them, all right? The truth will come out, soon enough.

AD_BusyInCart_0.speaker: Volo
AD_BusyInCart_0.text: Please - get me out of here!

AD_BusyInCart_1.speaker: Volo
AD_BusyInCart_1.text: Excuse me! A little help, if you don't mind!

AD_BusyInCart_2.speaker: Volo
AD_BusyInCart_2.text: Help me! Please! I can't feel my legs!

AD_Saved_0.speaker: Volo
AD_Saved_0.text: The secrets I would have taken to my grave if you hadn't intervened...

AD_Saved_2.speaker: Volo
AD_Saved_2.text: Come here a moment, will you?

AD_Saved_1.speaker: Volo
AD_Saved_1.text: You there - a word, if you please?

Onlooker04_0.speaker: Rabbelle
Onlooker04_0.text: It'll be instant, right? His death? That's how executions go, right? He won't suffer or anything...

Onlooker04_1.speaker: Rabbelle
Onlooker04_1.text: This isn't what I do on a daily basis. I was just passing by.
Onlooker04_1.context: NodeContext: trying to convince themself (not convinced at heart)

Onlooker04_2.speaker: Rabbelle
Onlooker04_2.text: I mean, you're here too. You understand.
